name: andqueries
title: And Queries
statement: You are given a weighted tree with N nodes numbered from 0 to N-1. Let cost(u, v) denote the bitwise AND of all edge weights on the shortest path between nodes u and v. The cost of the tree is the sum of cost(u, v) across all 0 < u < v < N. More formally, the cost of the tree is: \sum_u=0^N-2 \sum_v=u+1^N-1 cost(u, v) You have to process Q queries described by a triplet of integers U_j, V_j, X_j: the weight of the edge connecting nodes U_j and V_j changes to X_j. Print the cost of the tree before the first query and following each query.

highlights.name: Liceo Scientifico N. Copernico, Udine
highlights.description: is the institute with the most points (7)
